history.content: Taking 104 in the fall and 105 the next spring is something you won't regret if you're "mathematically inclined."

children.subject: OP here. I'm thinking of doing 61C and 16B in the fall with 170 pushed off to junior year. Reasonable?

If you're going to take 61C, I'd recommend taking it in the fall because you'll have Garcia/Lustig instead of Weaver. You can look at past posts about 61C if you want to get an idea of people's general opinion about the class and the professors.

As for 170, personally I don't think it matters when you take it, but keep in mind that it is a high workload class. If you're worried about interviews, you can always learn the relevant concepts before you take the class.

history.content:
I am intent on doing some subset of the following classes for the fall: EE 16B, CS 61C/170, EECS 126, Math 113/104, R1B. I want to take all of these classes between the fall and spring semesters but have no idea which order to do them so any advice would help (workloads, professors, best to take soon)

I will take Math 105/185 in the spring if I do 104 in the fall. I want to take 170 because I hear it helps with interviews but I am not sure if it is more beneficial to take in fall/spring and I want to take 126 so that I can do 189 soon. Please help
history.subject: No Idea What Classes to Take (Math and EECS)
